text:
Question: How to connect to corporate Wi-Fi on Windows?

Answer:
To connect to corporate Wi-Fi on Windows:
1. Click on the Wi-Fi icon in the taskbar.
2. Select the network "CORP-WIFI".
3. Click Connect.
4. Enter your corporate username in the format DOMAIN\username.
5. Enter your corporate password.
6. If a security certificate prompt appears, click Accept or Connect.

metadata.title: How to connect to corporate Wi-Fi on Windows?

text:
Question: I can see the Wi-Fi network but cannot connect. What should I check?

Answer:
If you see the Wi-Fi network but cannot connect:
1. Make sure your username and password are correct.
2. Check that your account is not locked in the corporate directory.
3. Move closer to the access point and try again.
4. Restart Wi-Fi adapter or reboot your laptop.
5. If the issue persists, contact IT Support and provide a screenshot of the error.

metadata.title: I can see the Wi-Fi network but cannot connect. What should I check?

text:
Question: How to connect to corporate VPN from home on Windows?

Answer:
To connect to corporate VPN from home on Windows:
1. Make sure you have a stable internet connection.
2. Open the VPN client (for example, Cisco AnyConnect).
3. Enter the VPN server address vpn.company.com.
4. Click Connect.
5. Enter your corporate username and password.
6. Approve multi-factor authentication if required.
7. After connection, you can access internal systems as if you were in the office.

metadata.title: How to connect to corporate VPN from home on Windows?

text:
Question: VPN connects but I still cannot open internal websites. What should I do?

Answer:
If VPN seems connected but internal websites are not available:
1. Check that you can open external websites (e.g., https://www.google.com).
2. Verify that the VPN client shows status Connected without errors.
3. Try to disconnect and reconnect to the VPN.
4. Clear browser cache or try another browser.
5. If the problem persists, contact IT Support and provide:
   - name of the internal website,
   - time of the problem,
   - a screenshot of the VPN client window.

metadata.title: VPN connects but I still cannot open internal websites. What should I do?

text:
Question: How to access corporate email from a web browser?

Answer:
To access corporate email from a web browser:
1. Open your browser and go to https://mail.company.com.
2. Enter your corporate username and password.
3. If you are outside the corporate network, you may need VPN or MFA.
4. If you forgot your password, use the password reset portal or contact IT Support.

metadata.title: How to access corporate email from a web browser?

text:
Question: How do I reset my corporate account password?

Answer:
To reset your corporate password:
1. Open the password self-service portal https://password.company.com.
2. Enter your username or email.
3. Confirm your identity using SMS or mobile app if configured.
4. Set a new password following the password policy requirements.
5. Wait 5–10 minutes and try to log in again.

metadata.title: How do I reset my corporate account password?

text:
Question: How to add a corporate network printer on Windows?

Answer:
To add a corporate network printer on Windows:
1. Connect to the corporate network (LAN or VPN).
2. Open Settings → Devices → Printers & scanners.
3. Click Add a printer or scanner.
4. Select the printer from the list or click "The printer that I want isn't listed".
5. Use the printer address in the format \\print-server\printer-name.
6. Click Next and install the driver if prompted.

metadata.title: How to add a corporate network printer on Windows?

text:
Ticket ID: INC-00123
Title: Cannot access corporate email from home

Description:
User reports that Outlook cannot connect to the corporate mailbox from home network.

Resolution:
Explained that VPN connection is required from outside the office. Asked the user to connect to VPN and restart Outlook. After VPN connection was established, email started working.

metadata.title: Cannot access corporate email from home

text:
Ticket ID: INC-00124
Title: VPN client shows authentication failed

Description:
User cannot log in to VPN. Error 'Authentication failed' is displayed.

Resolution:
Checked the user account in Active Directory and found it locked. Unlocked the account and asked the user to try again. VPN connection was established successfully.

metadata.title: VPN client shows authentication failed

text:
Ticket ID: INC-00125
Title: Laptop cannot connect to CORP-WIFI in meeting room

Description:
User can see CORP-WIFI but cannot connect in a specific meeting room.

Resolution:
Asked the user to move closer to another access point and try again. Also updated the Wi-Fi driver on the laptop. Connection to CORP-WIFI was successful after driver update.

metadata.title: Laptop cannot connect to CORP-WIFI in meeting room

text:
Ticket ID: INC-00126
Title: User cannot print to network printer PRN-01

Description:
Print jobs stay in queue on PRN-01 and do not print.

Resolution:
Restarted the print spooler service on the print server and cleared the stuck job. After that new print jobs were processed normally. Advised the user to try printing again.

metadata.title: User cannot print to network printer PRN-01

text:
# VPN Connection Guide for Windows

This runbook explains how to connect to the corporate VPN from a Windows laptop.

## Prerequisites

- An active internet connection.
- Installed corporate VPN client (for example, Cisco AnyConnect).
- Valid corporate VPN account.

## Steps

1. Open the **Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client**.
2. In the **VPN** field, enter the server address: **vpn.company.com**.
3. Click **Connect**.
4. In the authentication window:
   - Enter your corporate username.
   - Enter your corporate password.
5. If multi-factor authentication (MFA) is enabled:
   - Approve the push notification in the mobile app,
   - or enter the one-time code from SMS or authenticator app

metadata.title: VPN Connection Guide for Windows

text:
e push notification in the mobile app,
   - or enter the one-time code from SMS or authenticator app.
6. Wait until the VPN status changes to **Connected**.
7. Once connected, verify that you can open internal resources (for example, https://intranet.company.com).

## Troubleshooting

- If the client shows **Authentication failed**:
  - Verify that you are using the correct username and password.
  - Try logging into webmail with the same credentials.
  - If login fails everywhere, your account might be locked; contact IT Support.
- If VPN connects but internal sites are still unavailable:
  - Disconnect and reconnect the VPN.
  - Check that your firewall or antivirus does not block VPN traf

metadata.title: VPN Connection Guide for Windows

text:
Disconnect and reconnect the VPN.
  - Check that your firewall or antivirus does not block VPN traffic.
  - Try another network (for example, mobile hotspot) to exclude local network issues.

metadata.title: VPN Connection Guide for Windows

text:
# Wi-Fi Connection Guide for Windows

This runbook describes how to connect a Windows laptop to the corporate Wi-Fi network CORP-WIFI.

## Prerequisites

- A valid corporate account (username and password).
- Wireless adapter enabled on the laptop.
- Physical presence in the office where CORP-WIFI is available.

## Steps

1. Click the Wi-Fi icon in the taskbar.
2. Make sure Wi-Fi is turned on.
3. In the list of available networks, select **CORP-WIFI**.
4. Click **Connect**.
5. When prompted for credentials:
   - Enter your username in the format **DOMAIN\username**.
   - Enter your corporate password.
6. If a security certificate warning appears, verify that the network name is correct and c

metadata.title: Wi-Fi Connection Guide for Windows

text:
assword.
6. If a security certificate warning appears, verify that the network name is correct and click **Connect** or **Accept**.
7. Wait until the status changes to **Connected, secured**.

## Troubleshooting

- If the network is not visible:
  - Move closer to an access point.
  - Make sure Wi-Fi is not disabled by a hardware switch.
- If authentication fails:
  - Check that Caps Lock is not enabled.
  - Try logging into another corporate service to verify your credentials.
  - If you still cannot log in, contact IT Support to check if your account is locked.

metadata.title: Wi-Fi Connection Guide for Windows

text:
# IT Support Service Level Agreement (SLA) – Excerpt

This document describes the main SLA targets for incident handling.

## Priority Levels

- **P1 – Critical**
  - Complete service outage or major business impact.
  - Initial response time: **15 minutes**.
  - Target resolution time: **4 hours**.

- **P2 – High**
  - Significant degradation of service with workaround available.
  - Initial response time: **1 hour**.
  - Target resolution time: **8 business hours**.

- **P3 – Medium**
  - Standard incidents affecting a single user or small group.
  - Initial response time: **4 business hours**.
  - Target resolution time: **3 business days**.

- **P4 – Low**
  - Minor issues, cosmetic defe

metadata.title: IT Support Service Level Agreement (SLA) – Excerpt

text:
**.
  - Target resolution time: **3 business days**.

- **P4 – Low**
  - Minor issues, cosmetic defects, general questions.
  - Initial response time: **1 business day**.
  - Target resolution time: **5 business days**.

## Working Hours

- IT Support service desk working hours:
  - Monday–Friday, 9:00–18:00 (excluding public holidays).
- Incidents reported outside working hours are processed on the next business day, unless classified as P1.

metadata.title: IT Support Service Level Agreement (SLA) – Excerpt

text:
# Corporate Password Policy (Excerpt)

This document describes basic password requirements for corporate accounts.

## Password Requirements

- Minimum length: **12 characters**.
- Must contain characters from at least **three** of the following groups:
  - Uppercase letters (A–Z)
  - Lowercase letters (a–z)
  - Digits (0–9)
  - Special characters (!, @, #, $, %, etc.)
- Must not contain:
  - Your username
  - Your first name or last name
  - Obvious words such as "password" or "1234"

## Password Expiration

- Passwords must be changed at least once every **90 days**.
- Users will receive notification emails before password expiration.

## Account Lockout

- After **5** failed login attempt

metadata.title: Corporate Password Policy (Excerpt)

text:
ification emails before password expiration.

## Account Lockout

- After **5** failed login attempts, the account is locked for **15 minutes**.
- IT Support can unlock an account earlier upon user request after identity verification.

metadata.title: Corporate Password Policy (Excerpt)
